data.title: Great atmosphere, great service, awesomely fabulous food!
data.text: We went out for an evening with friends.  We started with appetizers- crab cakes and goat cheese with chutney, then we had walnut bread, then salads with dressings made in house.  Entrees included quail, rainbow trout and beef tenderloin. We were all so enjoyed our meals (and tastes of each others).  Desserts were cream brûlée, brownie with caramel sauce and ice cream, and chocolate mousse.  Everything was exquisitely delicious. We're all looking forward to another visit!

data.title: First choice for dinner!
data.text: The chef is very talented and the menu is delicious (great food and wine).  You will love the atmosphere and location.

data.title: Disappointing
data.text:
Wait staff was super nice and efficient.

Nice basic layout.  Good looking menu that changes regularly.

Salad was very good and bluefin app was very good.

I ordered the deep fried oysters.  They should be fresh and right out of the fryer with some crisp to them.  They were soggy.  Booo.  And the string beans were shriveled and old/dry.  My main course came out as soon as I was done my salad, so I have a feeling my dinner was ruined by a heat lamp.  It was defiantly the fault of the kitchen not the server.  It was as if my plate was done way before it should have been.

I would give them another chance, if I make it back to the area but if they don't wow me, thats all she wrote.

data.title: Best ever, rivals Chicago's best!
data.text: Twice we've enjoyed this marvelous place.  The service is unbelievably good - our salad forks were replaced after using them for hors d'oevres yay!!  Bill's sense of how to cook seafood blows us away.  Maine diver scallops - incredible.  Halibut Marseilles - unbelievable.  There is not enough good to say about this wonderful little place.  And the fact that they remembered us from our 1st visit, just charming.  We will return again & again & again!!

data.title: A + "hole in the wall" dining experience
data.text: We have dined here on several occasions and always a fantastic experience. The food is uniquely prepared and delicious. If in Owensboro you must dine here at least one time. Be sure and call 24 hours in advance to reserve your table. It is that amazing.

data.title: Fresh Fish Your Way
data.text: Wonderful selection of fresh fish. I had the turbot from the North Atlantic breaded and pan fried delish. Nice wine and beer selection as well, a little pricy but the food quality was well worth the $.

data.title: Bill's x 2
data.text: My husband and I decided to try Bill's for lunch after coming to Owensboro to visit with our daughter. I had a wonderful bacon/egg salad sandwich with a side salad, while  my husband had an Italian meat and cheese sandwich with fries. Both were very good and fresh. Service was  good. We asked about reservations (it is a small restaurant) for the evening dinner and not only were they able to seat us, but also accommidate our daughter who is gluten-free. When we arrived, they were very kind to her and not only made her feel comfortable,  but brought her a delicious gluten-free salmon dinner. I had the fried oysters (YUM)  and my husband had the duck (amazing). Elizabeth, our server was efficient and friendly and gave great recommendations. The reviews are true.  This place is not to be missed!

data.title: Five Star Meal
data.text: Intriguing beginning, which tasted even better than it looked on the plate. Speck (smoked porchetta, who knew?), topped with fresh figs (flavored with lemon zest and a bit of sugar), surrounded by goat cheese, and toast points.  Our main was Mako shark, very moist and meaty. This was served on fried green tomatoes, crowder peas cooked with onion slices (and just the right amount of spice). Excellent. We were lucky enough to be winding down as a wine rep arrived. Bill sent us a taste of a southern France Minervois red (not that we would have known without asking). We dug out our boxed-up appetizer, and thoroughly enjoyed the pairing.  Unfortunately, we had no room for dessert.

data.title: Run don't walk... amazing place.  Great food and service. Nice atmosphere.
data.text:
I'm still not quite sure how Owensboro KY ended up with a place like Bill's.  No offense to Owensboro or Bill (yes there is a Bill) but this was not what I expected to find.

The menu is heavy on seafood, but offers a little for everyone.  Daily menus based on what they can get locally and fresh.  Everything is cooked fresh and has nice sides, salad and warm bread.

The fried oysters were very good.  Flavorful and hot.  Side cocktail sauce was a nice complement.

Red Snapper was my main with green beans and mashed potatoes.  Prepared well in a vinegar sauce with walnuts the flavor was very good, and the sides complimented it well.

A full bar and many wine choices as well.

A few things to note.  Arrive early or have a reservation.  By 6pm this place was full and hopping.  Don't let the tablecloths scare you, it ain't too fancy.  I was wearing shorts as it was a hot/humid Kentucky day (go figure) and was concerned.  Soon after a family dressed the same arrived.  Folks seemed to come as they were, and the staff did not mind.  Lots of locals here and many knew each other.  Not a bad thing, and says something about the fare and prices.

Very reasonable for the level of meal and service, but not cheap.  Mid range I would say.

Recommend.

data.title: More carp and local fish!
data.text: Last Saturday we had the fried oysters as an appetizer and they were perfect.  My wife ordered the Snapper Ponchartrain and I ordered the Kentucky Lake Carp. The snapper was a bit too spicy for my wife so I swapped my carp for her snapper.  We were both so surprised and impressed with the carp. Please keep serving local fish; we will order it every time!

data.title: Comprimize and dine here.
data.text: A nice clean and quaint place for a great dinner date, highly recommend if your looking for a place to just have a quiet  personal dinner to get re-acquainted or just smooz, this is the place.

data.title: Best restaurant in Evansville, Henderson and Owensboro area
data.text: I have only been there one time but it was an inspiring meal.  Entrees include a modestly (just right) sized salad, a starch and a vegetable as well as protein.  My deep-fried oysters were the best I have had anywhere, even on the Gulf.  They were very large, succulent, juicy and just outstanding.  The breading was very good and they were not overcooked.  A friend had the Chilean sea bass and said it was excellent.  Another friend had the tenderloin with bordelaise sauce.  She said it was cooked just the way she ordered it (medium) and that it was very tender.  Bill's is getting only four stars because our service, including from the bar, was very erratic and  because the sauce delivered with the oysters which was supposed to be remoulade was tartar sauce.  Maybe it was an off night.  In any case, there is no other restaurant in the area whose food compares with the meal I had.

data.title: Outstanding Changing Menu
data.text: Bill's is perfect for foodies who love an always-changing menu packed with seasonal ingredients.  The appetizers, entrees, and desserts are freshly prepared on-site each day, resulting in cuisine that's innovative and delicious. The portions are appropriately sized and well-priced, considering the quality of the ingredients and thoughtful preparation. Bill's is my go-to choice for out-of-town business guests.

data.title: A Very Special Place to Eat!
data.text: Wonderful fresh entrees and great atmosphere. Bill works hard to make sure every dish is prepared perfectly.

data.title: Nice n quite
data.text: The food was excellent and the service equal.  Atmosphere was nice. You could actually hear your table partner. NO loud hip hop music. Small and really nice.

data.title: Absolutely Wonderful.. Will be back ASAP
data.text: Wonderful place to have a nice dinner as a couple or with friends.  Not a great place for the kiddos so get a babysitter.  Everything about my meal was great all they way from my House salad with home made dill sauce dressing and home made Walnut Bread.  My wife ordered a fruit cup because she is not a salad person.  I tried some of hers and every piece of fruit was ripe and delicious.  I ordered the Scallops and they were the best I have ever had.  Fresh, beautifully prepared and the flavor was out of this world.  We had the Creme Brûlée for desert and it was good as well.  I have no complaints about this experience.  I hope you try this restaurant.

data.title: Simple Excellence
data.text: This is a wonderful dining experience. The atmosphere is simple. The dining area is small. The food is fantastic! One of Owensboro's top restaurants. Simple, elegant and wonderful.

data.title: Can't wait to go back!!
data.text:
Small cozy spot with tons of ambience!  Elizabeth was our server and was so professional, attentive, and friendly. Menu is varied. Favorites at our table were the filet and pork chop. These features were absolutely wonderful.  Prices were average and well worth the money.  Reservations are recommended.

Our group drove 45 minutes to go to this restaurant and am looking forward to going again!  Excellent food and service!

data.title: Great food and service
data.text: Atmosphere is intimate and just wonderful. I would suggest reservations and the dining area is small. The menu changes often but mine and my wife's dishes were wonderful as was the fresh walnut bread.

data.title: Great place to visit!
data.text:
We only live 35 miles from Owensboro but had never heard of Bill's until seeing it on the TTT TV show. 

It's a small place so be sure to make reservations. We did and were seated quickly at our reservation time. Very good wine list. The menu changes daily so you really don't what to expect until you get there. But it's all very well prepared and delicious.
